intro: Ardisia tortuguerensis, commonly known as the Tortuguesa ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the islands of Cuba and Hispaniola. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are visually striking. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
